title: Her Majesty's Spymaster: Elizabeth I, Sir Francis Walsingham.ep

Sir Francis WalsinghamÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s official title was principal secretary to Queen Elizabeth I, but in fact this pious, tight-lipped Puritan was EnglandÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s first spymaster. A ruthless, fiercely loyal civil servant, Walsingham worked brilliantly behind the scenes to foil ElizabethÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s rival Mary Queen of Scots and outwit Catholic Spain and France, which had arrayed their forces behind her. Though he cut an incongruous figure in ElizabethÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s worldly court, Walsingham managed to win the trust of key players like William Cecil and the Earl of Leicester before launching his own secret campaign against the queenÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s enemies. Covert operations were WalsinghamÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s genius; he pioneered techniques for exploiting double agents, spreading disinformation, and deciphering codes with the latest code-breaking science that remain staples of international espionage.
